Theme Park
Ready, set, explore! With more than 50 rides, shows and attractions designed for kids to take the lead, awesome awaits at LEGOLAND Florida Resort!
Water Park
We hope you've been practicing your cannonball! Get ready to slide, splash and build your way to fun at LEGOLAND Water Park.
World's First Peppa Pig Theme Park!

SEA LIFE Florida Aquarium
Discover the amazing wonders of the underwater world at SEA LIFE Florida at LEGOLAND Florida Resort! Embark on a voyage of oceanic exploration, ending in the ultimate seascape - The Theme Park Under the Sea!

FAQs
Where is LEGOLANDÂ® Florida?
LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort is located in Winter Haven, right in the heart of Central Florida. Just an hour away from both Orlando and Tampa, our location offers easy access for travelers coming from either direction. The closest major airport is Orlando International Airport (MCO), approximately 55 miles (88 kilometers) away.
Our address is:
LEGOLAND Florida Resort,
One LEGOLAND Way
Winter Haven, FL 33884
Find directions here.
Looking for places to stay? Explore top-rated hotels near
LEGOLAND Florida Resort
for convenient access to all the fun.
How much is parking at LEGOLANDÂ® Florida?
You can save both time and money by purchasing your parking in advance online. Secure your spot with Pre-Paid Parking
here
.
Current Parking Rates:
Standard Parking: $35 + tax
Preferred Parking (closer to entrance): $55 + tax
Motorcycles: $25 + tax (on-site purchase only)
Campers/RVs: $40 + tax (on-site purchase only)
Buses & Bicycles: Free
Additional Parking Info:
Accessible parking is available near the entrance with a valid placard. The cost is the same as standard parking.
Re-entry is allowed the same day with a valid parking stub.
Toll and ticket booths open approximately 30â€“45 minutes before the park opens.
When did LEGOLANDÂ® Florida open?
LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort officially opened on October 15, 2011, in Winter Haven, FL, on the historic grounds of Cypress Gardens. Construction began in 2010, transforming the former botanical park into one of the premier theme parks in Florida for families.
What is there to do at LEGOLANDÂ® Florida?
LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort is packed with fun for families with kids ages 2â€“12. The park offers a wide variety of attractions that combine creativity, fun, and adventure. Hereâ€™s just a glimpse of what youâ€™ll find:
Ride Family-Friendly Coasters: Enjoy favorites like
The Dragon
and
Coastersaurus
.
Interactive Adventures: Take on rides like
LEGOÂ® NINJAGOÂ® The Ride
and
Lost Kingdom Adventure.
Miniland USA
: Discover incredible LEGOÂ® models of famous U.S. landmarks.
LEGOLANDÂ® Water Park
: Splash around with water slides, a lazy river, and more.
Botanical Gardens
: Wander through the beautifully preserved historic Cypress Gardens.
With over 50
shows
,
rides and attractions
, it's a top choice for a Florida family vacation and creating unforgettable memories.
What Time Does LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Open?
LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Theme Park hours may vary by day and season. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, check the
LEGOLAND Florida Opening Hours calendar.
Toll and ticket booths open 30â€“45 minutes before park opening, so you can park and enter smoothly when gates open.
Note: Hours for LEGOLANDÂ® Water Park and PEPPA PIG Theme Park Florida may differ.
Reservations are not required, and tickets can be purchased at the gate. However, we strongly recommend buying LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort tickets online in advance for the best prices and to guarantee entry during busy times. Book your tickets
here
.
Want to make the most of your visit?
Discover more planning tips and details
to help you have the most AWESOME day at LEGOLAND Florida Resort.
How Big is LEGOLANDÂ® Florida?
LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort spans 150 acres, making it the second-largest LEGOLANDÂ® park in the world. It features over 50 attractions across themed lands like LEGOÂ® Kingdoms,
LEGOÂ® NINJAGOÂ® World
, and LEGOÂ® City.
With so much to see â€” including the
LEGOLAND Water Park
,
SEA LIFE Florida
and
Peppa Pig Theme Park
â€” one day often isnâ€™t enough. Why not extend the fun with a stay at one of our on-site hotels for a truly immersive experience:
LEGOLAND Hotel
:Â  Just steps from the park with themed rooms and daily entertainment.
Pirate Island Hotel
: A fully interactive, pirate-themed adventure.
Beach Retreat
: A seasonal lakeside getaway with LEGOÂ®-themed bungalows.
Staying longer lets you enjoy more, revisit favorite attractions, and make the most of your visit â€” all with exclusive guest perks and unbeatable convenience.
What age group is LEGOLANDÂ® Florida designed for?
LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort is designed for kids ages 2 to 12, making it an ideal spot for families with young children. Rides, attractions, and themed zones are fun, interactive, and age-appropriate.
Adults are welcome tooâ€”whether visiting with kids or on their own. Grown-ups can enjoy the creativity of
Miniland USA
, stroll through the botanical gardens, or join the fun on family-friendly rides.
The best age range is typically 4 to 10, when kids are tall enough for most rides and fully engaged. That said, toddlers and tweens will also find plenty to enjoy.
What Can I Bring to LEGOLANDÂ® Florida?
Backpacks and wagons are allowed inside LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort. Please note: all bags and personal items are subject to search, so we recommend packing light and keeping valuables secure. Guests may also bring limited outside food and drinks, provided they follow park guidelines.
Allowed:
Bottle water/ Small snacks
Baby & medical food
Small soft coolers
Not Allowed:
Alcohol/ glass
Heated/ perishable food
Large or wheeled coolers
For more details, click
here
to learn more.
Dining options available! LEGOLANDÂ® Florida has something to satisfy every appetite, explore our dining options
here.
Have someone in your party with allergies? Check our
Dietary Guide
to help plan your visit around specific dietary needs.

LEGOLANDÂ® Florida Resort officially opened on October 15, 2011, in Winter Haven, FL, on the historic grounds of Cypress Gardens. Construction began in 2010, transforming the former botanical park into one of the premier theme parks in Florida for families.
